topic: How to package REST APIs using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to package REST APIs using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Python 3.12+ FastAPI Guide: Packaging REST APIs
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to use FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+.
key_points: FastAPI is built on top of Starlette and provides automatic documentation and type annotations.
It supports async/await, which improves performance and scalability.
FastAPI handles common HTTP patterns out of the box, such as routing, middleware, request and response objects, etc.
It can be easily integrated with popular databases (SQLAlchemy), ORMs (SQLModel), and other services.
version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for using FastAPI.
Upgrading to Python 3.12 offers performance improvements in some areas.
caveats: Ensure all your dependencies are compatible with Python 3.12.
FastAPI's async nature might require adjustments if you come from synchronous frameworks like Flask or Django.
